# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Here is a Julia function to solve the problem. We will use DataFrames.jl package for handling data frames.

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> year(x)*100 + month(x), df[:dt])
end
```

In this function, `map` applies a function to each element in a column of the DataFrame. The function here is an anonymous function that extracts the year and month from a DateTime object and returns them as an integer.

This function can be used like so:

```julia
df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2020, 1, 1), DateTime(2021, 2, 29)],
               other_column=["a", "b"])
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This will add a new column `ym` to the DataFrame with values [202001, 202102] for the two rows.
